etymologies: from modern Latin nicotiana (herba) ‘tobacco (plant)’, named after Jean Nicot, a 16th-century French diplomat who introduced tobacco to France in 1560

definitions: an ornamental plant related to tobacco, with tubular flowers that are particularly fragrant at night.

notes.text: Genus Nicotiana, family Solanaceae: several species, in particular N. alata

shortDefinitions: ornamental plant related to tobacco, with tubular flowers that are particularly fragrant at night
